visual_description: Marqa Zeitoun, a Tunisian Jewish Djerban stew traditionally made with chicken or beef but adapted here as vegan, visually appears as a **rich, medium-thick stew** characterized by a **deep olive-greenish or brownish hue** due to the significant presence of *zeitoun* (olives) and slow-cooked vegetabl...
raw_response:
Marqa Zeitoun, a Tunisian Jewish Djerban stew traditionally made with chicken or beef but adapted here as vegan, visually appears as a **rich, medium-thick stew** characterized by a **deep olive-greenish or brownish hue** due to the significant presence of *zeitoun* (olives) and slow-cooked vegetables/spices. The consistency is typically more solid-than-soupy—more like a thick, hearty stew rather than a soup—so it holds together but has some saucy liquidity around the ingredients.
